snippet: Politicians and even some technologists say Silicon Valley’s efforts to crack down on the use of social media and other technologies like encryption by terrorists have been toothless.
abstract: Politicians and some technology experts say Silicon Valley's attempts to diminish or stop terrorists' use of social media and use of encryption technologies are ineffectual; example of pro-Islamic State group calling itself Asawitiri Media, which created 335 Twitter accounts when Twitter attempted to cut off authors of account, highlighted.

byline.original: By NICOLE PERLROTH and MIKE ISAAC
byline.contributor: Nicole Perlroth reported from San Francisco and Mike Isaac from New York. Cecilia Kang and Michael S. Schmidt contributed reporting from Washington.

lead_paragraph: Politicians and even some technologists say Silicon Valley’s efforts to crack down on the use of social media and other technologies like encryption by terrorists have been toothless.

headline.print_headline: Terrorists Mock Bids to End Use of Social Media
headline.main: Terrorists Mock Bids to End Use of Social Media

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
